citation.article-title: Haloferula luteola sp. nov., an endophytic bacterium isolated from the root of a halophyte, Rosa rugosa, and emended description of the genus Haloferula
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Haloferula Yoon et al. 2008
Characteristics are the same as given in the original description of the genus Haloferula (Yoon et al., 2008) with the following amendments.
The DNA G+C content is 58.5â€“65.0 mol%.

The polar lipid profile consists of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol, while traces of an unknown glycolipid are detected in the type strain of the type species.
